cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 530 mi ESE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest across the north-western Gulf toward the mid-Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: between Port O'Connor and Corpus Christi, TX (mid-Texas coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Mansfield to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Texas coast from Port Mansfield through High Island, with secondary impacts into southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤14%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts possible late Friday into Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1–3 ft possible along the upper Texas coast, including Galveston Bay entrance
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could total 2–4 inches with localized higher amounts; temporary flooding of low-lying port facilities possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas in the ship channel, dangerous rip currents along nearby beaches, and reduced visibility during downpours could disrupt vessel movements and cargo operations.
